commit_message:
Update tls_container_id to tls_container_ref

Since the Listener TLS container references are not
UUIDs, the API was changes slightly to refer them as
'refs'. This commit updates the CLI to reflect this
subtle but important change as well.

Change-Id: Ifd4639de79469d531f683f4a02455dbdb4b12f7f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-28 14:14:26.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_build_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/build.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent/commit/b3e65cac72ec5405afcf10875f98345f7abc3291', 'message': 'Add apt-get upgrade after debootstrap

We then configure apt inside image chroot (including preferences) and
then we run apt-get install. But we need to make sure
those packages installed by debootstrap will be also
upgraded to their versions that available in trusty-updates and

commit_message:
Add apt-get upgrade after debootstrap

The issue is that debootstrap is only able to
work with one suite. We run it with vanilla distro (e.g. trusty).
We then configure apt inside image chroot (including preferences) and
then we run apt-get install. But we need to make sure
those packages installed by debootstrap will be also
upgraded to their versions that available in trusty-updates and
trusty-security. So, we need to run apt-get upgrade inside chroot.

Change-Id: I75b6c8b77604a24cead54f6ea57193e416da0f0d
Closes-Bug: #1489646
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent refs/changes/83/218283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cmds = ['chroot', chroot, 'apt-get', '-f', '-y', 'upgrade'] stdout, stderr = utils.execute(*cmds, attempts=attempts) LOG.debug('Running apt-get upgrade completed.\nstdout: %s\nstderr: %s', stdout, stderr)

commit_message:
Unify using of migration tools

Currently magnum has two type of migration tools, one is oslo.db
migration_cli, other is calling alembic migration tool directly.
This fixes to get more consistency.

Closes-Bug: #1487248
Change-Id: I705dd2cc65c1f879ce1e2ebaaf2015dc6dc24c64

"""Database setup and migration commands.""" from oslo_config import cfg from stevedore import driver _IMPL = None def get_backend(): global _IMPL if not _IMPL: cfg.CONF.import_opt('backend', 'oslo_db.options', group='database') _IMPL = driver.DriverManager("magnum.database.migration_backend", cfg.CONF.database.backend).driver return _IMPL def upgrade(version=None): """Migrate the database to `version` or the most recent version.""" return get_backend().upgrade(version) def version(): return get_backend().version() def stamp(version): return get_backend().stamp(version) def revision(message, autogenerate): return get_backend().revision(message, autogenerate) def create_schema(): return get_backend().create_schema()

commit_message:
Respect rolling update params on the initial batch

Don't count members that are being created (in order to temporarily
increase the effective capacity to meet the minimum-in-service as batched
updates occur) as being in-service until they are actually finished. Also,
ensure that only a maximum of batch-size resources are either created or
updated to the new definition in each batch.

This also bring the implementation of InstanceGroup and the
AutoscalingGroups into line with ResourceGroup, and allows ResourceGroup to
make use of the heat.scaling.rolling_update library functions in the
future.

Change-Id: I912daff18716cee0d445e96a6d2d50f22192260c
Partially-Implements: blueprint scaling-group-common
Closes-Bug: #1488971

commit_message:
Don't set MYSQL_DRIVER in local.conf.sample.

local.conf.sample set MYSQL_DRIVER=MySQL-python to match what was
being done in OpenStack CI for Neutron.  This is no longer the case as
the related issues in Neutron have mostly been solved.

OpenStack CI for OVN was already running on the new MYSQL_DRIVER
default, but this change will make local runs of devstack use the new
default, too.

Change-Id: Ie3ac5f0e8e23559884bef7bb234448b1bca2515e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

added_lines: def get_open_ports(self, node_group): np = set(node_group.node_processess) ports = [] # some random ports if "namenode" in np: ports.append(9999) if "datanode" in np: ports.append(10000) if "jobtracker" in np: ports.append(9998) if "tasktracker" in np: ports.append(7777) return ports

commit_message:
Add compression in common capabilities doc

Compression is a common attribute, so add
the compression capability in common capabilities
doc.

Change-Id: I97ca506c7d6be627079c28191d0fb3ab2470ffed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/85/214485/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * `compression` - indicates that a backend/pool can provide shares using some compression technology. The default value of the compression capability (if a driver doesn't report it) is False. Drivers cannot report to the scheduler that they support both compression and non-compression share. For each pool it's either always on or always off. Administrators can make a share type use compression by setting this extra-spec to '<is> True'. Administrators can prevent a share type from using compression by setting this extra-spec to '<is> False'. Added in Liberty. {'pool_name': 'thin-dedupe-compression pool', #\ 'compression': True, #\ 'compression': False,

commit_message:
Update documentation for multiple VLAN ranges

Update example configuration file and installation guide to
mention support for multiple VLAN ranges on a particular
network and provide examples. Also address other minor
issues with networking content in the installation guide.

Change-Id: Idca97092f326cfbd83a018e853d3e7655d20e491
Partial-Bug: #1475436
(cherry picked from commit c3025ed093e80fbb1d7ed91651341fe139102436)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/98/215898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Configure the management network in the ``provider_networks`` subsection: .. code-block:: yaml provider_networks: - network: group_binds: - all_containers - hosts type: "raw" container_bridge: "br-mgmt" container_interface: "eth1" container_type: "veth" ip_from_q: "management" is_container_address: true is_ssh_address: true #. Configure optional networks in the ``provider_networks`` subsection. For example, a storage network: container_type: "veth"#. Configure OpenStack Networking VXLAN tunnel/overlay networks in the container_type: "veth"#. Configure OpenStack Networking flat (untagged) and VLAN (tagged) networks in the ``provider_networks`` subsection: container_type: "veth" container_interface: "eth12" host_bind_override: "eth12" net_name: "flat" container_type: "veth" Replace *``VLAN_ID_RANGE``* with the VLAN ID range for each VLAN network. For example, 1:1000. Supports more than one range of VLANs on a particular network. For example, 1:1000,2001:3000. Create a similar stanza for each additional network.
deleted_lines: #. Configure optional networks in the ``provider_networks`` subsection:#. Configure OpenStack Networking tunnel/overlay network in the#. Configure OpenStack Networking provider networks in the ``provider_networks`` subsection: container_interface: "eth11" net_name: "vlan" Replace *``VLAN_ID_RANGE``* with the VLAN ID range for each VLAN provider network. For example, 1:1000. Create a similar stanza for each additional provider network.

commit_message:
Fix OVS bond for l23network module

* Add lacp states calculation
* Rise error if bridge is not defined for ovs provider
* Add bridge creation for ovs bonds
* Add ordering for l3::ifconfig
* Up parent interface for vlan port
* Correct condition for bond port

Change-Id: I463368e6d6a48cf1a92113b4fc75cc87ebf08020
Closes-bug: #1488566

added_lines: $lacp_states = [ 'off', 'passive', 'active' ] if ! $bond_properties[lacp] { # default value $lacp = $lacp_states[0] } else { $lacp = $bond_properties[lacp] } lacp => $lacp,

subject: Avoid envirnoment marker parsing error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-15 21:49:50.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/addbaa82cd7d8d6e8b81ff1948fd4ff251144aad', 'message': "Avoid envirnoment marker parsing error

Having comments in lines with an environment marker seems to cause
a parsing error. For example, in the networking-ovn project:

error in setup command:
  Invalid environment marker: (python_version=='2.7' # Apache-2.0)

Removing the comments allows devstack to complete successfully.

Change-Id: I80a1f381df2344d1bc323bad44cceb83f40bd8d0
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid envirnoment marker parsing error

Having comments in lines with an environment marker seems to cause
a parsing error. For example, in the networking-ovn project:

error in setup command:
  Invalid environment marker: (python_version=='2.7' # Apache-2.0)

Removing the comments allows devstack to complete successfully.

Change-Id: I80a1f381df2344d1bc323bad44cceb83f40bd8d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/10/202310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ovs>=2.4.0.dev0;python_version=='2.7'pyngus>=1.3.1;python_version=='2.7'requests-kerberos>=0.6;python_version=='2.7'

commit_message:
devstackgaterc: Run some security group tests.

I think that this subset of security group tests are fine to run.
They should only require the API to manage security groups, which
should be working.

Change-Id: I3f7737e9d3803c8813ee0d4d9271248743ecaf1e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

POC code for BP extension driver converting

WIP now, just include the address-pair converting.
